How it works: for the cost of $100, our White-Glove agents deliver your mattress, adjustable base, foundation, and/or bed frame on a date that works best with your schedule. Once onsite, the delivery team will bring the items to your room of choice, set up them up and remove any packaging. Our White-Glove agents are limited to arranging and setting up Bear products only.

Looking to have your old mattress removed? For the total cost of $150, our White-Glove agents will deliver and set up your new items, plus remove your old mattress*. Only one mattress removal is allowed per order. Mattress removal must be completed at the same time as the delivery of your new mattress.

Our White-Glove In-Home Setup is available when you order the Bear Mattress, Bear Hybrid, mattress with Bear Foundation and Frame, and/or the Bear Adjustable Base.

Products NOT INCLUDED with White-Glove In-Home Setup are soft accessories, Pillow(s), Bear Protector or Bear Bedding. These items will get delivered to your shipping address via our standard FedEx Ground service.

Qualifying products will be shipped directly to your local delivery team hub. Please note, because items will be shipped directly to the local delivery team, you will not receive FedEx tracking information for these products.

Your local White-Glove agents will call you to schedule a delivery date once they have received your order. The evening before your delivery, you\'ll receive another call to confirm your delivery window**. You will receive a call on the day of delivery when the driver is roughly 30 minutes from your location.

It will take approximately 2–3 weeks from the date of order to receive your products. Should you need your order sooner, select Free Shipping via FedEx Ground at checkout.

*Mattress removal is based on driver\'s discretion. **We cannot guarantee a specific 4-hour window will be available.

settings.section_rich_text: We’re happy to help out. Give our support team a call.

We recommend you unbox the Hybrid within 3 weeks of delivery and the Original and Pro within 30 days.

  1. We recommend having a friend or two help set up your new mattress.
  2. Remove the mattress from the box in the bedroom you would like to keep it in.
  3. Place vacuum-sealed mattress onto your bed base.
  4. Unroll the first layer of plastic
  5. Unfold the mattress and align the top of the mattress with the top of the bed frame.
  6. Carefully use scissors to cut away the plastic wrapping. Your mattress will begin to expand immediately!
  7. Cut the plastic around the perimeter of the mattress and remove.
  8. The bed should be completely expanded in less than a minute!
  9. While your mattress can be used right away, we recommend giving it a full 24hrs to completely decompress.

settings.faq_heading: What should I rest my mattress on?
settings.faq_content:
Our beds are designed to lay on any hard, flat surface. We highly recommend the Bear Foundation paired with a bed frame. Other options include a platform bed, adjustable base, or the floor. We don't recommend using a traditional coil box spring, because it does not provide an evenly distributed surface area for foam-based mattresses.

Read more about bed bases

settings.faq_heading: Will Bear work for my sleep position?
settings.faq_content:
YES, back, side, stomach and combo! If you are a side or combo sleeper we recommend Star Hybrid. If you are a back or stomach sleeper we recommend Bear Original. If you are a side sleeper we recommend Star Hybrid.

Read more about sleep positions

settings.faq_heading: Can Bear mattresses help with my back pain?
settings.faq_content: A mattress made with low-quality foams or setup on an improper foundation (like a traditional box spring) can cause sinkage and misalign your spine. Your sleep position can also contribute to a sore back, or straight-up back pain. Bear offers comfortable, supportive, and durable mattresses which keep your back in a neutral position to help support your body's unique curves. Have back problems? See how adjusting your sleep position can help with a bad back.

settings.faq_heading: Will Bear work for my size?
settings.faq_content: YES, our mattresses are made to support all weights and heights! Every mattress features high-density support foam that is built to last. Whatever your sleep style, our mattresses will contour to your body to ensure you sleep soundly all night long. If you are particular about the firmness level of your mattress, the Bear Elite Hybrid gives you the option to customize your mattress to fit perfectly for you.

settings.faq_heading: How would you rate the firmness of the Bear Hybrid?
settings.faq_content: We designed the Bear Hybrid with a nice plush, hand-tufted top, so you feel like you’re floating on a cloud, while your back and body benefit from a firm core support. Overall, it is rated as a medium-firm mattress, and on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being most firm, Bear Hybrid is categorized as a 6.8.

settings.faq_heading: What is the difference between a Bear Hybrid and other mattresses?
settings.faq_content: The Bear Hybrid is a premium mattress combining both coils and foams to create a 13” sleep system that provides a luxury feel, like your favorite hotel bed, that helps you recover faster and sleep better. In the same tradition as our Original mattress, the Bear Hybrid uses Celliant® technology woven into the cover, as well as high air-flow layers to help you sleep cool. The difference is the Bear Hybrid uses copper-infused gel and has individually wrapped pocketed coils for best-in-class edge support and a hand-tufted quilted top to give you a cloud-like mattress feel.

settings.faq_heading: Does the Bear Hybrid reduce motion transfer so my partner won't feel me move?
settings.faq_content: Yes! With the Bear Hybrid's individually wrapped pocketed coils and proprietary design, there is the benefit of reduced motion transfer so you and your partner can move around as you sleep without disturbing one another.

settings.faq_heading: Is the Bear Hybrid made in the USA?
settings.faq_content: Yes! In the same tradition as the Bear Mattress, our Bear Hybrid is manufactured here in the US in our Wisconsin factory. The Bear Hybrid uses CertiPur-US Certified foams of the highest quality.

settings.faq_heading: How would you rate the firmness of the Bear Original?
settings.faq_content: We designed the Bear Original to have a solid core support with a responsive comfort layer using gel infused foam for cooling comfort. We would categorize the mattress as a medium-firm. With over 9,800 verified customer reviews, our customers give the Bear Original a firmness rating of 7.1 on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the most firm.

settings.faq_heading: What sets the Bear Original apart from other foam mattresses?
settings.faq_content: The Bear Original was engineered using multiple layers of cooling, contouring, and comforting memory foam to increase the pressure relieving properties that help you sleep better and recover faster. We also go beyond traditional foams and use gel infused foam in the comfort layer and our own responsive transition foam to keep your body cool and spine aligned. Plus, it comes with our Celliant® technology woven in the cover to promote cooling and recovery. Celliant is a unique fiber that utilizes natural minerals to reflect your body’s natural energy back as light. We worked with experts around the world to design a mattress that is universally comfortable, sleeps cool, helps you recover faster and increases your energy.

settings.faq_heading: Does the Bear Original have a break-in period?
settings.faq_content: No, the mattress is great from the start! It will probably take you some time to adjust to the feel so we ask you to sleep on the Bear Original for at least 30 nights before you decide to keep or return it.

settings.faq_heading: Does the Bear Original smell?
settings.faq_content: The Bear Mattresses uses foams that have little to no smell. If anything, it would be very slight when you first unpack the mattress, like a new pair of sneakers, and then will dissipate within a couple days.

settings.faq_heading: What mattresses will work with the Bear Adjustable Base?

settings.faq_heading: How does the Adjustable Base work with my current bedframe?
settings.faq_content: The Bear Adjustable Base can fit inside a sleigh bed or common four-post bed. No part of the frame moves downwards, which allows you to remove the legs and rest the adjustable frame itself on the floor or on top of a platform base.

settings.faq_heading: Can my partner and I move independently of each other on the Adjustable Base?

These separate units can also be synced to move together. Additional instructions are included with the owner’s manual you'll receive upon delivery.

settings.faq_heading: What is Celliant Sleep Technology made from?
settings.faq_content: Celliant® is a revolutionary, patented technology that, through the use of fibers, converts the body’s natural energy (heat) into infrared (IR) light and emits it into the body’s tissue and muscles. The result is a responsive textile, clinically proven to benefit the human body, utilizing a blend of minerals and proprietary ingredients embedded into the fiber’s core.

settings.faq_heading: Does Celliant still work with the mattress protector and sheets on the bed?
settings.faq_content: Yes. Celliant’s patented technology is embedded into the core of the fibers so that it cannot wash or wear out. The technology is not based on a coating or an application. Therefore, the benefits of Celliant technology last the life of the fiber and products do not require special care.

settings.faq_heading: Will I feel Celliant working?
settings.faq_content: While you will not necessarily be able to perceive or feel an increase in circulation, oxygenation or blood flow, clinical testing has measured an increase in skin oxygen levels (TCPO2) and consistently recorded significant improvements across a wide spectrum of test subjects. Consumers who try Celliant often experience increased comfort and an overall improved sense of health.

settings.faq_heading: Are there clinical studies to prove Celliant works?
settings.faq_content:
Yes, Celliant technology has been tested and proven in five U.S. based clinical studies.

See Clinical Studies | Read the Press Release

settings.faq_heading: Are there any negative side effects to Celliant?
settings.faq_content: Celliant is a non-invasive technology. Allergic reactions to any materials can occur; however, since Celliant products became available in 2003, there have been no reported cases of allergic reactions. However, as Celliant requires a synthetic carrier, you should not use Celliant if you are allergic to polyester fibers.

settings.faq_heading: How long until I can sleep on my Bear mattress?
settings.faq_content: Bear mattresses will be good to sleep on as soon as it’s fully expanded. The mattress might take 24-48 hours to fully decompress depending on the length of time it was in the box.

settings.faq_heading: What foundation do you have your Bear mattress on?
settings.faq_content: Our beds are designed to lay on any hard, flat surface. We highly recommend the Bear Foundation paired with a bed frame. Other options include a platform bed, adjustable flex bed, or the floor. We don't recommend using a traditional coil box spring, because it does not provide an evenly distributed surface area for foam-based mattresses.

settings.faq_heading: How long have you been sleeping on your Bear mattress?
settings.faq_content: Our bodies are all very different, and some people may need a bit more time to adjust to a new sleep surface and receiving proper support. A new mattress is a big change and we feel that 30 nights is enough time to adjust and decide whether or not the Bear Mattress is right for you.

settings.section_rich_text: We hear it a lot:  “How firm are your mattresses? I need a soft mattress that won’t hurt my back.” It’s easy to get hung up on firmness level when looking for a new mattress, but what most people actually need is the right combination of comfort and support —something we’re calling the Sweet Spot.

settings.message:
Firm

  • Expect a less-hugging or contouring feeling
  • Feels more “on top of” the mattress than “sinking in”
  • The most stable and even surface

Medium

  • The most universally liked
  • Balanced, with just the right amount of sinkage, hug, and contour
  • Preferred by those who change positions at night
  • Best for couples

Soft

  • The most returned type of mattress
  • Plush, sinking-in feel
  • Tends to sag quickly
  • More likely to cause pain over time

settings.section_description: So, what is mattress firmness and why is it important? Very simply, firmness is how much a mattress pushes back on your body when you lay on it. Firm mattresses push back the most, while soft mattresses barely do, and in some cases just plain cave in. A firm mattress does not always mean a supportive mattress.

settings.section_rich_text: Firmness has a different meaning for each of us. What is perfect for one person could seem rock-solid, or far too squishy to someone else. Your age, gender, body type, weight, previous mattress experience, and other factors all play a role in your perception of firmness. That’s why Bear makes mattresses in the sweet spot. Still unsure about which mattress is best for you? Take our sleep quiz for more help.

settings.section_header: The Technology Behind the Best Sleep
settings.section_rich_text: Our Elite Hybrid is engineered with Phase Change Material (PCM) and Celliant(TM) technology to promote all-night cooling and natural recovery. settings.faq_content: We designed the Pro Hybrid to include a 6" base of up to 1032 individually encased coils to offer deep compression support while decreasing motion transfer between sleep partners. settings.faq_heading: What sets the Pro Hybrid apart from other mattresses?
settings.faq_content: The Pro Hybrid was engineered using multiple layers of cooling, comforting memory foam and 6" of individually encased coils to increase the pressure relieving properties that help you sleep better and recover faster. We also go beyond traditional foams and use Gel Infused Memory Foam in the comfort layer and Bear Dynamic Foam to keep your body cool and spine aligned. We worked with experts around the world to design a mattress that is universally comfortable, sleeps cool, helps you recover faster and increases your energy.

settings.faq_heading: Does the Pro Hybrid smell?
settings.faq_content: Bear uses foams that have little to no smell. If anything, it would be very slight when you first unpack the mattress, like a new pair of sneakers, and then will dissipate within a couple days.

settings.faq_heading: What should I rest the Pro Hybrid on?

We don't recommend using a traditional coil box spring, because it does not provide an evenly distributed surface area for foam-based mattresses.

settings.faq_heading: What is the difference between All Foam and Hybrid?
settings.faq_content:
An all-foam mattress gives your body a unique level of support, aiding in spinal alignment and hugging your body no matter your favorite sleep position. Plus, this is the best option if you or your partner need shock absorption to reduce motion transfer.

A hybrid mattress uses innerspring coils, so you’re getting that tried-and-true support, deeper compression, and classic responsive bounce of a traditional mattress. The top layers of memory foam offer comfort, spinal-alignment, and reduced motion transfer.

We also go beyond traditional foams and use cooling-gel memory foam in the comfort layer and our own responsive transition foam to keep your body cool and spine aligned. Choose the Celliant infused cover to get Celliant® technology woven in to promote cooling and recovery. Celliant is a unique fiber that utilizes natural minerals to reflect your body’s natural energy back as light. We worked with experts around the world to design a mattress that is universally comfortable, sleeps cool, helps you recover faster and increases your energy.

settings.faq_heading: Does the Bear Original have a break-in period?
settings.faq_content: No, the mattress is great from the start! It will probably take you some time to adjust to the feel so we ask you to sleep on the Bear Original for at least 30 nights before you decide to keep or return it.

settings.faq_heading: Does the Bear Original smell?
settings.faq_content: Bear uses foams that have little to no smell. If anything, it would be very slight when you first unpack the mattress, like a new pair of sneakers, and then will dissipate within a couple days.

settings.faq_heading: What type of base do I need for the Bear Original mattress?
settings.faq_content: Our bed is designed to lay on any hard, flat surface. We highly recommend the Bear Foundation paired with a bed frame. Other options include a platform bed, adjustable base, or the floor. We don't recommend using a traditional coil box spring, because it does not provide an evenly distributed surface area for foam-based mattresses.

settings.faq_heading: What is the difference between All Foam and Hybrid?
settings.faq_content: Memory foam, unlike a traditional spring mattress, offers the sensation of contouring your body — a kind of shock absorption for your back that keeps you comfortable throughout the night. With a hybrid, you’ve still got the feeling of a mattress hugging you to sleep, but you also have a… more romantic innerspring bounce. In general, hybrid mattresses tend to have more options when it comes to firmness than memory foam.

Made in our Arizona factory, using US and international parts.

The Bear Natural mattress uses 100% organic cotton in the cover, certified to the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) by CU 00064899.

This certification indicates that the cotton used in the cover has been independently verified to be organic and ethically produced from beginning to end.The Global Organic Textile Standard is the leading textile processing standard for organic fibers across the globe, backed up by independent certification of the entire supply chain, including both social and ecological criteria.

The Bear Natural mattress is GREENGUARD Gold Certified

Simply put, GREENGUARD Certification ensures that a product has met some of the world's most rigorous and comprehensive standards for low emissions of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) into indoor air.

The GREENGUARD Gold Certifications requirements comply with the State of California’s Department of Public Health Services Standard Practice for Specification Section 01350 (California Section 01350) for testing chemical emissions from building products used in schools and other environments. As such, GREENGUARD Gold Certified products can be used to earn valuable credits in the CHPS Best Practices Manual for K-12 schools, the US Green Building Council's LEED® Green Building Rating Systems, the Green Guide for Healthcare, the NAHB Green Building Guidelines, Green Globes, Regreen and many other building codes, standards and specifications.

Bear Natural's layers are CertiPUR-US® certified.

  • Made without ozone depleters
  • Made without Polybrominated Diphenyl Ethers (PBDE) flame retardants
  • Made without mercury lead and other heavy metals
  • Made without formaldehyde
  • Made without phthalates regulated by the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC)
  • Contains low Volatile Organic Compound (VOC) emissions for indoor air quality (less than 0.5 parts per million)

settings.faq_heading: I’m allergic to latex. Is that a problem?

Although skin-to-latex does not occur during normal use, we suggest you consult your allergist prior to purchase if you are uncertain.
